basics.name: Ivan du Toit
basics.label: Snr Software Development Engineer
basics.summary: Ivan du Toit is an eager learner willing to do any task that delivers the most value to the business, large or small. He has a record of keeping track of complex domains while leading high performance teams at companies like Amazon Web Services

work.position: Amazon Web Services (Software Development Engineer III)
work.summary: Focus on migrating our legacy GWT stack to a new React based stack as well as a new design system. I also own the management of our shared component repository and drive adoption of a consistent experience and quality across 8 console teams. I also working on the architectural changes required in our backend infrastructure to reduce our infrastructure cost by more than 50%.
highlights: Create and drive code sharing by changing org culture towards code sharing and ownership
Create tools to facility code and design sharing
Build a analytics solution for our product to drive data driven decisions
Guide design and migration of our backend infrastructure to a AWS native and serverless solutions
Slim down and optimize the backend infrastructure to reduce the cost by more than 50%
API and customer experience bar raiser for EC2

work.position: Amazon Web Services (Software Development Engineer II)
work.summary: I am the team lead for the team that builds the EC2 management console. My focus is on increasing operational excellence and increasing our delivery velocity. This includes training new team members and driving the development of a DSL and framework to allow us to delivery more value to out customers, faster.
highlights: Driving and getting projects delivered across teams
Steering and delivering a platform for increase delivery in multiple team
Increased normalized project delivery by 50% YoY for 2 years while the team only grew 10%
Driving the architectural and team changes required by the rapid scaling we are going though
Course creator and presenter for first time oncalls
API and customer experience bar raiser for EC2

work.summary: I worked in the User Experience team to build the < href="https://console.aws.amazon.com/ec2/home">EC2 and VPC management consoles. To increase my exposure I am also involved in EC2 API design. Giving back is also important to me by helping newbies in operational excellence 101 training along with mentoring and helping interns
highlights: Reducing my teams operation incidents and load by 20% by driving good operational practice
Training all new on-calls to prepare for their first rotation
Initiating and delivering two big customer asks without impacting the teams roadmap

work.summary: I worked in the User Experience team to build a UI testing framework based on CasperJS and PhantomJS.
highlights: Learned a lot about testing and the impact of good testing on velocity
The framework and design is the bases of the testing used 3 years later

Web applications development and testing including creating a custom content management system. Lead development on the CMS during the last year.
